title: Exclusive: Cash-strapped RFU faces £6m bonus payments bill if England win World Cup after opting against insurance
text:
The cash-strapped Rugby Football Union are facing a bill of more than £6million in bonus payments if England win the World Cup final on Saturday.

The RFU opted against taking out an insurance policy to cover extra pay-outs before the tournament meaning that beating South Africa in Tokyo will actually damage the governing body's financial health in the short-term, rather than boost it.

The squad of 32 players - 31 in the original party, plus the recently called-up Ben Spencer - are understood to be due to share a pot of over £5m in bonuses. That sum is likely to increase to more than £6m when the bonus payments to head coach Eddie Jones and his coaching staff and management team are included. ...
